intro: Psychotria tonduzii, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant cultural and medicinal importance in traditional practices.
